bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon, August 12, 1952

div1.p: Hench requests information regarding newspaper reports about the Camp Lazear dedication.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon, August 12, 1952
div1.opener:
August 12, 1952
Senora Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon
Calle K 254
Vedado, Habana, Cuba
My dear Senora Rodriguez Leon:
div1.p:
I would appreciate it greatly if you would let me know what you hear
or see in the paper about the dedication of Camp Lazear, presumably
at the end of September. If the newspapers are still in error, I would
like to know it as we can put on further pressure at the appropriate
time.

I of course called Doctor Nogueira's attention to your presence in Habana
and it would be ridiculous if you and your husband were not invited to
the dedication. If there is any slip, if you don't seem to be invited,
for heaven's sake let me know and I will diplomatically do the proper
thing.

One more point, please let me know whether or not your father had a
middle name.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
